title: Quality Quotes 1
description: Using quotes from the work of the great Robert M. Pirisig to live a better life

transcript_parts.text: hi there welcome to quality quotes in
which I read a quote from the work of
the great Robert in piercing and discuss
how its wisdom can help us live a better
life today's quote is from chapter 1 zen
and the art of motorcycle maintenance
[Music]
you see things vacationing on a
motorcycle in a way that is completely
different from any other in a car you're
always in a compartment and because
you're used to it you don't realize that
through that car window everything you
see is just more TV you're a passive
observer and it is all moving by you
boringly in a frame on a cycle the frame
is gone you're completely in contact
with it all you're in the scene not just
watching it anymore and the sense of
presence is overwhelming that concrete
whizzing by five inches below your foot
is the real thing the same stuff you
walk on it's right there so blurred you
can't focus on it yet you can put your
foot down and touch it any time and the
whole thing the whole experience is
never removed from immediate
consciousness the iconic motorcycle trip
depicted and said in the art of
motorcycle maintenance took place in the
late 60s at that time television was the
on demand screen that was available even
then I think people who were whereas of
course Peirce it was that that
distillation of human experience to
within a frame could serve to isolate
people from the natural world observing
human behavior in the Internet age
proves this beyond a shadow of a doubt
we react to what comes up on our screens
as if it is real because it's calculated
to effectively evoke that realness
psychologist John gravity has pointed
out how the virtual world contains all
the elements to cognitively satisfy some
of our deep personal and societal needs
all in all the screen that can be a
powerful deception it makes us feel like
we are living and participating in
dynamic reality when really we are
mostly passively engaging
in a predetermined virtual experience
now there is something to be said for
television and the Internet in terms of
Life Enrichment a major tenet of pr6
philosophy was that we need to work with
technology not against it he thought we
should engage with technology in a high
quality way in a way that makes life
better and we can together with our
loved ones we can experience a great
mythic narrative on Netflix as it
teaches us more about ourselves we can
connect with long-lost friends on
Facebook whom we end up visiting in
person we can promote small businesses
that give people artisan and handcrafted
say alternatives to corporate products
on Instagram and on Etsy these are high
quality endeavors they add to the
dynamic richness of life and they
improve our lot but as Pierson points
out to substitute the screen for the
experience makes you a passive observer
of nature you're not connecting with the
dynamic exhilarating and unpredictable
reality around you you're not in contact
with the full experience of being alive
and this is something I think we don't
even know we're missing because so many
things we want from life
seem to be provided within these virtual
worlds which are increasingly able to
emulate an experience of realness on the
surface these objects of experience are
titillating underneath this titillation
is short-lived it quickly becomes boring
and we need the next fix
it's shots of style but not substance
Pierce had warned against mistaking
style for quality and objects for
reality because of that overwhelming
sense of presence that nature gives us
the awe it affords us and the deep
connections we have from having evolved
from the tiniest particle of inorganic
matter we need to from time to time
participate in the world the real world
that which is truly and spontaneously
dynamic we need to connect to that
whizzing dynamism that Robert in his son
felt just below them and around them so
what is the solution get out of the
frames there are two that are address
chair one is that which contains your
life so comfortably the technological
frame of comfort these cars that are
air-conditioned and transport us to
wherever we want to go these dwellings
that are always the perfect temperature
and predictably provide us with all our
material needs the second of course is
the frame around the experience the
screen sometimes you need to get away
from the thermostats and the cushions
and the dopamine pleasure provided by
Twitter Facebook and even YouTube and
get back in contact with it all and out
into the Sun or the snow or the wind get
back in touch with some of those
elements that technology has conquered
our ancestors may have had lives that
were nasty brutish and short but they
never felt apathy or ambivalence about
the dynamic forces of nature they
understood them in all their terror and
beauty maybe we need to reclaim some of
that so I hope that made sense and I
will see you next week for another quote
for quality existence
[Music]
